channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Police searched for suspects in unapproved trial of facial recognition tech, Clearview AI
item.description: An unapproved police trial of controversial facial recognition software conducted dozens of searches for suspects in New Zealand.

item.title: High income earners, returning Kiwis among benefit applicants
item.description: Those who signed on for the benefit during lockdown were more likely to be first time beneficiaries and higher earners, a new report shows.

item.title: Live Covid-19 updates from New Zealand and around the world on 15 May
item.description: Qatar has made the wearing of face masks compulsory, one in four US workers are claiming jobless benefits and in NZ a Budget to help fight Covid-19 was announced.

item.title: $400m to be spent on bigger, faster Interislander ferries
item.description: The Interislander ferry service expects to increase passenger numbers when it trades in its three existing ships for two bigger new ones by 2025.

item.title: Current benefits 'not sufficient to survive on', social welfare groups say
item.description: The government is being warned many more families will fall into poverty if it doesn't boost support for people losing their jobs because of Covid-19.

item.title: Budget 2020: General practitioners want to have say in division of extra support
item.description: GPs say they've been passed over in the Budget and want to be at the table when the extra health support the government has promised is divvied up.

item.title: Budget 2020: Tourism funding not enough - tourism leaders
item.description: Tourism got a $400 million funding boost in Budget 2020, but industry leaders say it is not enough to keep them afloat and does not provide a clear plan.

item.title: Covid-19: Developments in New Zealand on 14 May
item.description: It was the third day in a row NZ reported no new cases of the virus, the Budget plans unveiled more support for the pandemic response, and businesses had a bittersweet welcome to level 2.

item.title: NZME files injunction over Stuff deal
item.description: Media company NZME is digging its heels in over a potential purchase of its rival Stuff and is seeking an injunction against Stuff's owner Australia's Nine Entertainment.

item.title: As it happened: Covid-19 updates from New Zealand and around the world
item.description: New Zealand has now had three days in a row of no new cases of Covid-19. See how the rest of the day developed with RNZ's live blog.

item.title: Covid-19: Courts work through Monday reopening at level 2
item.description: The Chief Justice is considering how courts could run socially-distanced jury trials later this year.

item.title: Early-morning bungy jump prelude to flights resuming
item.description: Queenstown has rolled out the welcome mat to domestic visitors with the return of the first passenger flights since 1 April.

item.title: Man faces dangerous driving charges after deaths of two sisters
item.description: A man has been charged over a fatal crash in Christchurch's Port Hills last year.

item.title: Homeless man looks for positives from lockdown troubles
item.description: The lockdown has proved a difficult seven weeks for many New Zealanders - including a man forced to live in his car in Wellington.

item.title: 'First flight to freedom': Regional airport back in business
item.description: The coffee machines were back in action, and sparrows gathered crumbs from the floor of the Nelson Airport terminal as a smattering of passengers hopped on resumed regional flights.

item.title: Budget 2020: Trades training gets $1.6bn boost
item.description: Trade training gets a $1.6 billion Budget boost aimed at trainees and their employers.

item.title: Budget 2020: What you need to know
item.description: The government has unveiled a $50 billion recovery package as part of today's Budget. Here's a breakdown of where Budget 2020's money is going.

item.title: Budget 2020: $50bn rescue fund in 'once in a generation' budget
item.description: A $50 billion rescue fund sits at the centre of 2020's "once in a generation Budget" as the country braces for the economic carnage promised by Covid-19.
